name: First Photographic Evidence of Soviet Military Buildup
Further Confirmation of Soviet Military Activity
US Intelligence Identifies Missile Transport Equipment
US Intelligence Identifying Surface-To-Air Missile Installations
First Installation of Soviet Nuclear Missiles
US Confirmation of Soviet Missiles in Cuba
US Public Announcement of Missile Presence
Letter Exchanges Between Kennedy and Khrushchev
Shooting Down of US U-2 Reconnaissance Plane
Initial Responses to the U-2 Incident

comprising_events.name: Initial Secret Meeting between RFK and Dobrynin
RFK's Proposal of Dismantling Jupiter Missiles

alternate_choices.name: No Agreement on Turkey
alternate_choices.description: The U.S. could have decided not to offer the removal of the Jupiter missiles from Turkey. This would have likely prolonged the crisis and increased the risk of military conflict.

comprising_events.name: Complete Withdrawal of Soviet Personnel from Cuba
comprising_events.description: The U.S. could have insisted that not only the missiles but all Soviet military personnel be withdrawn from Cuba. This would have been a hardline stance that the Soviet Union would likely have resisted, potentially escalating the conflict.

comprising_events.name: Bilateral Disarmament Agreement
comprising_events.description: The U.S. and the Soviet Union could have used the crisis as an opportunity to negotiate a broader bilateral disarmament agreement.

outcome_description: Reduced tensions between the two superpowers
significant step towards de-escalation of the Cold War.

comprising_events.name: United Nations Involvement
comprising_events.description: The leaders could have brought the negotiations to the United Nations to involve the international community in the resolution of the crisis.

consequences.consequence_desc: This might have increased pressure on both nations to find a peaceful resolution but could also have complicated the negotiations.

name: Letter from Khrushchev Offering Missile Removal
US Agrees Not to Make Invasion Pledge Public

comprising_events.name: RFK Delivers Message of Secrecy to Dobrynin
US Continues Public Stance on Cuban Issue

alternate_choice.name: Public Disclosure of the Entire Agreement
alternate_choice.description: The leaders could have decided to make the entire agreement, including the removal of U.S. Jupiter missiles from Turkey, public. This would have required a more significant diplomatic effort to manage the potential backlash from NATO allies.

name: US Response Agreeing to Missile Removal Terms
